auth_token.Description: The API auth key for API operations.

default_route.Description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default

status.Description: Status of the session - up or down

facility.Description: Facility where the connection will be created

metro.Description: Metro where to the connection will be created

mode.Description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

name.Description: Name of the connection resource

organization_id.Description: ID of the organization responsible for the connection

ports.Description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`)

id.Description: ID of the connection port resource

name.Description: Name of the connection port resource

speed.Description: Port speed in bits per second

virtual_circuit_ids.Description: List of IDs of virtual circuits attached to this port

project_id.Description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, only used for type == "shared"

speed.Description: Port speed in bits per second

access_private_ipv4.Description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv4.Description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv6.Description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device

always_pxe.Description: If true, a device with OS custom_ipxe will

created.Description: The timestamp for when the device was created

custom_data.Description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device

deployed_facility.Description: The facility where the device is deployed

deployed_hardware_reservation_id.Description: ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed. It is useful when using the next-available hardware reservation

facilities.Description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or any (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response. Conflicts with metro

force_detach_volumes.Description: Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies for destroy action

hardware_reservation_id.Description: The UUID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your next available reservation automatically

hostname.Description: The device hostname used in deployments taking advantage of Layer3 DHCP or metadata service configuration.

ip_address.Description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below)

cidr.Description: CIDR suffix for IP block assigned to this device

reservation_ids.Description: IDs of reservations to pick the blocks from

ipxe_script_url.Description: URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More

metro.Description: Metro area for the new device. Conflicts with facilities

network.Description: The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 addresses: public ipv4, private ipv4 and ipv6

cidr.Description: CIDR suffix for IP address block to be assigned, i.e. amount of addresses

public.Description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet

network_type.Description: Network type of a device, used in [Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Will be one of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded
network_type.Deprecated: You should handle Network Type with the new metal_device_network_type resource.

operating_system.Description: The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit [Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response

plan.Description: The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit [Device plans API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response

bonded.Description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

mac.Description: MAC address assigned to the port

name.Description: Name of the port (e.g. eth0, or bond0)

project_id.Description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

project_ssh_key_ids.Description: Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be created with the [metal_project_ssh_key](project_ssh_key.md) resource

deprovision_fast.Description: Whether the OS disk should be filled with `00h` bytes before reinstall

enabled.Description: Whether the device should be reinstalled instead of destroyed

preserve_data.Description: Whether the non-OS disks should be kept or wiped during reinstall

root_password.Description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours)

ssh_key_ids.Description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys

storage.Description: JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/) doc

termination_time.Description: Timestamp for device termination. For example "2021-09-03T16:32:00+03:00". If you don't supply timezone info, timestamp is assumed to be in UTC.

updated.Description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated

user_data.Description: A string of the desired User Data for the device

wait_for_reservation_deprovision.Description: Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019)

device_id.Description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set

type.Description: Network type to set. Must be one of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

ip_reservation_id.Description: UUID of the IP Reservation to associate, must be in the same metro as the VLAN

private_ipv4_subnet_size.Description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet to create for this gateway, one of [8 16 32 64 128]

project_id.Description: UUID of the Project where the Gateway is scoped to

vlan_id.Description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

cidr.Description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

global.Description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

network.Description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

public.Description: Flag indicating whether IP block is addressable from the Internet

name.Description: The name of the Organization

bonded.Description: Flag indicating whether the port should be bonded

disbond_supported.Description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.Description: Flag indicating whether the port is in layer2 (or layer3) mode

name.Description: Name of the port to look up, e.g. bond0, eth1

native_vlan_id.Description: UUID of native VLAN of the port

network_type.Description: One of layer2-bonded, layer2-individual, layer3, hybrid and hybrid-bonded. This attribute is only set on bond ports.

port_id.Description: UUID of the port to lookup

reset_on_delete.Description: Behavioral setting to reset the port to default settings. For a bond port it means layer3 without vlans attached, eth ports will be bonded without native vlan and vlans attached

vlan_ids.Description: UUIDs VLANs to attach. To avoid jitter, use the UUID and not the VXLAN

device_id.Description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

force_bond.Description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false

native.Description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use depends_on pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above

port_name.Description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

backend_transfer.Description: Enable or disable [Backend Transfer](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/backend-transfer/), default is false

bgp_config.Description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/)

asn.Description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deployment_type.Description: "local" or "global", the local is likely to be usable immediately, the global will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

max_prefix.Description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.Description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.Description: Status of BGP configuration in the project

created.Description: The timestamp for when the project was created

name.Description: The name of the project

organization_id.Description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account

payment_method_id.Description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with organization_id, or default)

updated.Description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

description.Description: Description string for the API key

project_id.Description: UUID of project which the new API key is scoped to

read_only.Description: Flag indicating whether the API key shoud be read-only

created.Description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.Description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.Description: The name of the SSH key for identification

owner_id.Description: The UUID of the Equinix Metal API User who owns this key

project_id.Description: The ID of parent project

public_key.Description: The public key. If this is a file, it

updated.Description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

cidr.Description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

facility.Description: Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4, conflicts with metro

global.Description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

metro.Description: Metro where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4, conflicts with facility

network.Description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

project_id.Description: The metal project ID where to allocate the address block

public.Description: Flag indicating whether IP block is addressable from the Internet

quantity.Description: The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

tags.Description: Tags attached to the reserved block

type.Description: Either global_ipv4 or public_ipv4, defaults to public_ipv4 for backward compatibility

devices_max.Description: Maximum number devices to be created

devices_min.Description: Miniumum number devices to be created

facilities.Description: Facility IDs where devices should be created

instance_parameters.Description: Parameters for devices provisioned from this request. You can find the parameter description from the [metal_device doc](device.md)

max_bid_price.Description: Maximum price user is willing to pay per hour per device

metro.Description: Metro where devices should be created

project_id.Description: Project ID

wait_for_devices.Description: On resource creation - wait until all desired devices are active, on resource destruction - wait until devices are removed

fingerprint.Description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.Description: The name of the SSH key for identification

public_key.Description: The public key. If this is a file, it

read_only.Description: Flag indicating whether the API key shoud be read-only

user_id.Description: UUID of user owning this key

description.Description: Description of the Virtual Circuit resource

name.Description: Name of the Virtual Circuit resource

nni_vlan.Description: Equinix Metal network-to-network VLAN ID (optional when the connection has mode=tunnel)

port_id.Description: UUID of the Connection Port where the VC is scoped to

project_id.Description: UUID of the Project where the VC is scoped to

speed.Description: Description of the Virtual Circuit speed. This is for information purposes and is computed when the connection type is shared.

status.Description: Status of the virtual circuit resource

tags.Description: Tags attached to the virtual circuit

vlan_id.Description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

facility.Description: Facility where to create the VLAN

project_id.Description: ID of parent project

vxlan.Description: VLAN ID, must be unique in metro

connection_id.Description: ID of the connection to lookup

facility.Description: Slug of a facility to which the connection belongs

metro.Description: Slug of a metro to which the connection belongs

mode.Description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

name.Description: Name of the connection resource

organization_id.Description: ID of organization to which the connection belongs

ports.Description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`)

id.Description: ID of the connection port resource

name.Description: Name of the connection port resource

speed.Description: Port speed in bits per second

virtual_circuit_ids.Description: List of IDs of virtual circuits attached to this port

project_id.Description: ID of project to which the connection belongs

speed.Description: Port speed in bits per second

access_private_ipv4.Description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv4.Description: The ipv4 management IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv6.Description: The ipv6 management IP assigned to the device

billing_cycle.Description: The billing cycle of the device (monthly or hourly)

facility.Description: The facility where the device is deployed

hardware_reservation_id.Description: The id of hardware reservation which this device occupies

metro.Description: The metro where the device is deployed

network.Description: The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks: ublic IPv4 at metal_device.name.network.0, IPv6 at metal_device.name.network.1 and private IPv4 at metal_device.name.network.2. Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).

cidr.Description: Bit length of the network mask of the address

public.Description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet

network_type.Description: L2 network type of the device, one oflayer3, hybrid, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

operating_system.Description: The operating system running on the device

plan.Description: The hardware config of the device

bonded.Description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

mac.Description: MAC address assigned to the port

name.Description: Name of the port (e.g. eth0, or bond0)

type.Description: Type of the port (e.g. NetworkPort or NetworkBondPort)

project_id.Description: The id of the project in which the devices exists

root_password.Description: Root password to the server (if still available)

ssh_key_ids.Description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user or project SSH keys

md5_enabled.Description: Whether BGP session is password enabled

md5_password.Description: BGP session password in plaintext (not a checksum)

multihop.Description: Whether the neighbor is in EBGP multihop session

peer_as.Description: Peer AS number (different than customer_as for EBGP)

peer_ips.Description: Array of IP addresses of this neighbor's peers

routes_in.Description: Array of incoming routes. Each route has attributes

routes_out.Description: Array of outgoing routes in the same format

device_id.Description: UUID of BGP-enabled device whose neighbors to list

plan.Description: Plan which has to be available in selected location

code.Description: The code of the Facility to match

features_required.Description: Features which the facility needs to have.

name.Description: The name of this Facility.

gateway_id.Description: UUID of the Metal Gateway to fetch

ip_reservation_id.Description: UUID of the IP Reservation to associate, must be in the same metro as the VLAN

private_ipv4_subnet_size.Description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet to create for this gateway, one of [8 16 32 64 128]

project_id.Description: UUID of the Project where the Gateway is scoped to

state.Description: Status of the virtual circuit resource

vlan_id.Description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

device_id.Description: UUID of device occupying the reservation

id.Description: ID of the hardware reservation to look up

project_id.Description: UUID of project this reservation is scoped to

provisionable.Description: Flag indicating whether the reserved server is provisionable or not. Spare devices can't be provisioned unless they are activated first

spare.Description: Flag indicating whether the Hardware Reservation is a spare. Spare Hardware Reservations are used when a Hardware Reservations requires service from Metal Equinix

switch_uuid.Description: Switch short ID, can be used to determine if two devices are connected to the same switch

facility.Description: Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and metro, all the block from the project will be listed

global_ipv4.Description: List of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project

ipv6.Description: List of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project

metro.Description: Metro code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and facility, all the block from the project will be listed

private_ipv4.Description: List of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project

project_id.Description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks

public_ipv4.Description: List of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project

plan.Description: Plan which has to be available in selected location

code.Description: The code of the Metro to match

name.Description: The name of this Metro.
Name or part of the name of the distribution. Case insensitive
The organization name

organization_id.Description: The UUID of the organization resource

project_ids.Description: UUIDs of project resources which belong to this organization

bonded.Description: Flag indicating whether the port is bonded

device_id.Description: Device UUID where to lookup the port

disbond_supported.Description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.Description: Flag indicating whether the port is in layer2 (or layer3) mode

name.Description: Name of the port to look up, e.g. bond0, eth1

native_vlan_id.Description: UUID of native VLAN of the port

network_type.Description: One of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

port_id.Description: UUID of the port to lookup

address_family.Description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

cidr.Description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidr_notation.Description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

facility.Description: Facility of the searched block. (for non-global blocks).

global.Description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

metro.Description: Metro of the searched block (for non-global blocks).

network.Description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

project_id.Description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.Description: Whether to look for public or private block.

backend_transfer.Description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project

bgp_config.Description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/)

asn.Description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deployment_type.Description: Private or public, the private is likely to be usable immediately, the public will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

max_prefix.Description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.Description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.Description: Status of BGP configuration in the project

created.Description: The timestamp for when the project was created

name.Description: The name which is used to look up the project

organization_id.Description: The UUID of this project's parent organization

payment_method_id.Description: The UUID of payment method for this project

project_id.Description: The UUID by which to look up the project

updated.Description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

user_ids.Description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which belong to this project

id.Description: The id of the SSH Key

name.Description: The label of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

project_id.Description: The Equinix Metal project id of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

public_key.Description: The public SSH key that will be authorized for SSH access on Equinix Metal devices provisioned with this key

search.Description: The name, fingerprint, id, or public_key of the SSH Key to search for in the Equinix Metal project

cidr.Description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidr_notation.Description: CIDR notation of the looked up block

facility.Description: Facility of the block. (for non-global blocks)

gateway.Description: IP address of gateway for the block

global.Description: Addresses from block are attachable in all locations

id.Description: ID of the block to look up

metro.Description: Metro of the block (for non-global blocks)

public.Description: Addresses from public block are routeable from the Internet

type.Description: Address type, one of public_ipv4, public_ipv6 and private_ipv4

price.Description: Current spot market price for given plan in given facility

device_ids.Description: List of IDs of devices spawned by the referenced Spot Market Request

devices_max.Description: Maximum number devices to be created

devices_min.Description: Miniumum number devices to be created

end_at.Description: Date and time When the spot market request will be ended.

max_bid_price.Description: Maximum price user is willing to pay per hour per device
